Many years ago, I had visited a local computer shop, looking for an inexpensive wireless mouse. Owner told me, you might prefer a cheap, Chinese mouse, but it will drain the battery so fast, that you might regret your decision. I am reminded of that incident, when I started using this mouse. I went for this mouse, since it's an HP product and I expected quality. For the record, the mouse is smooth and works fine. But in the 4+ months that I used it, I changed the batteries (2 AAA sized batteries) at least twice. This particular mouse really consumes the batteries so fast, users will get frustrated. Imagine having to replace the 2 nos. AAA size batteries (total cost Rs 30) every 2 months. So effectively the additional cost is Rs 150-180 a year for the batteries alone! I earlier had a Logitech mouse, which DID NOT eat up the battery so fast. And incidentally, the Logitech mouse worked with one AA sized battery, so overall additional cost was far lesser. Very disappointed with this HP mouse, and unlikely to buy any model of HP wireless mouse again. Key lessons: 1. Look up user reviews about how long batteries last in the mouse 2. Preferably go for a mouse which requires only 1 AA sized battery. Hope readers find this review useful.

review_title: Can be made ones with more sturdy dongles please
review: Good one. However, the dongle is puny. The problem I've been having with the puny ones is that they're not very sturdy. I always carry these on my laptop. They go in and out of my bag a couple of times a day, attached to my laptop. Eventually, every 2-3 months the dongle breaks or rather the glue holding the pieces together comes off. Since the dongle is puny and the contact surface very small, it's impossible to glue the pieces back together again. That results in me having to buy a new wireless mouse, every 2-3 months. I wish they would make larger dongles like they used to.
